prompt: Capture Deciding whether to move a protected set of limited/new SKUs into the two weeks before Thanksgiving to capture early intent (lift vs. cannibalization and margin preservation).. Scene: Dim backstage-studio hybrid: matte black worktable against a deep charcoal backdrop, negative space around subjects, hints of concrete and stage curtains.. Persona: Store operations lead and studio producer in collaboration — two silhouettes leaning across the table (operator with a worn utility jacket; studio producer with a linen notebook).. Action: Hands arrange a short run of physical SKU samples and handwritten cohort cards; a second hand lifts a translucent play sheet into the light to compare sequences.. Urgency symbol: A taut, thin filament stretched between two lit panes that frays into fine sparks where the decision will 'snap' — symbolic tension indicating timing sensitivity without a clock.. Key objects: matte-wrapped SKU samples tagged 'S1' (early-availability test), small marquee token 'S2' (flagship drop), branded pop-up swatch 'S3', brushed-steel data tag 'S4' (AI pricing pilot), demo badge 'S5' (high-ticket promo), handwritten A/B cohort cards, single-page printouts. Lighting: Moody, low-key dark-mode: deep shadows, a single cool tungsten key on the samples, rim light to separate silhouettes, heavy negative space.. Mood: Tense, disciplined collaboration — calculated risk framed as creative problem solving.. Props: matte-wrapped SKU samples tagged 'S1' (early-availability test), small marquee token 'S2' (flagship drop), branded pop-up swatch 'S3', brushed-steel data tag 'S4' (AI pricing pilot), demo badge 'S5' (high-ticket promo), handwritten A/B cohort cards, single-page printouts. dark-mode editorial photography, charcoal + cyan palette, dramatic edge lighting, single subject, generous negative space, cinematic contrast, not a poster, not a collage, not an infographic, no charts, no UI, no labels
